DataElement.preferredDefinition: The different types of probiotics taken.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A live microorganism used as a dietary supplement to help with digestion and normal bowel function. It may also help keep the gastrointestinal (GI) tract healthy. A bacterium found in yogurt called Lactobacillus acidophilus, is the most common probiotic.:Having been accepted for some purpose; ingested as a medication.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A live microorganism used as a dietary supplement to help with digestion and normal bowel function. It may also help keep the gastrointestinal (GI) tract healthy. A bacterium found in yogurt called Lactobacillus acidophilus, is the most common probiotic.

Concepts.definition: A live microorganism used as a dietary supplement to help with digestion and normal bowel function. It may also help keep the gastrointestinal (GI) tract healthy. A bacterium found in yogurt called Lactobacillus acidophilus, is the most common probiotic.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having accepted for some purpose; ingested as a medication.

Concepts.definition: Having been accepted for some purpose; ingested as a medication.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A live microorganism used as a dietary supplement to help with digestion and normal bowel function. It may also help keep the gastrointestinal (GI) tract healthy. A bacterium found in yogurt called Lactobacillus acidophilus, is the most common probiotic._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An micronutrient-fortified fermented dairy product with potential positive immunomodulatory activity. Micronutrient-fortified probiotic yogurt contains various micronutrients in addition to beneficial microorganisms, such as strains of Lactobacillus. Probiotic Lactobacillus strains have been shown to protect against gastrointestinal and urogenital infections, to moderate diarrheal episodes, and to increase CD4 T-lymphocyte counts. In immunocompromised subjects, micronutrient supplementation may also increase CD4 T-lymphocyte counts._A nutritional supplement composed of a fermented milk drink prepared by inoculating cow, goat, or sheep milk with kefir grains, with potential immunomodulating and probiotic activities. Upon oral administration of kefir, the kefir grains may stimulate the proliferation of beneficial bacteria in the gastrointestinal (GI) tract. This modulates the GI flora ecosystem, improves the functions of the intestinal barrier and protects against harmful viruses and bacteria. In addition, this prebiotic modulates the immune system and may inhibit inflammation._A yogurt made from a plant-based milk rather than animal's milk.

Concepts.definition: An micronutrient-fortified fermented dairy product with potential positive immunomodulatory activity. Micronutrient-fortified probiotic yogurt contains various micronutrients in addition to beneficial microorganisms, such as strains of Lactobacillus. Probiotic Lactobacillus strains have been shown to protect against gastrointestinal and urogenital infections, to moderate diarrheal episodes, and to increase CD4 T-lymphocyte counts. In immunocompromised subjects, micronutrient supplementation may also increase CD4 T-lymphocyte counts.

A nutritional supplement composed of a fermented milk drink prepared by inoculating cow, goat, or sheep milk with kefir grains, with potential immunomodulating and probiotic activities. Upon oral administration of kefir, the kefir grains may stimulate the proliferation of beneficial bacteria in the gastrointestinal (GI) tract. This modulates the GI flora ecosystem, improves the functions of the intestinal barrier and protects against harmful viruses and bacteria. In addition, this prebiotic modulates the immune system and may inhibit inflammation.
A yogurt made from a plant-based milk rather than animal's milk.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A fermented food made from thinly cut cabbage.

Concepts.definition: A fermented food made from thinly cut cabbage.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A traditional Korean side dish made from salted and fermented vegetables, usually cabbage and/or radish.

Concepts.definition: A traditional Korean side dish made from salted and fermented vegetables, usually cabbage and/or radish.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A traditional Japanese paste made by fermenting soy beans._A traditional Japanese food consisting of whole fermented soy beans._A traditional cake-like Indonesian food made from fermented soy beans.

Concepts.definition: A traditional Japanese paste made by fermenting soy beans.
A traditional Japanese food consisting of whole fermented soy beans.
A traditional cake-like Indonesian food made from fermented soy beans.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A fermented, lightly effervescent, sweetened black tea drink.

Concepts.definition: A fermented, lightly effervescent, sweetened black tea drink.

PermissibleValues.value: Aged cheeses (aged cheddar, gouda, gruyere etc. or raw milk cheeses)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Aged cheeses (aged cheddar, gouda, gruyere etc. or raw milk cheeses)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cheese that is left to ripen over weeks, months, or years. This alters its consistency and allows it to develop a more complex flavor.

Concepts.definition: Cheese that is left to ripen over weeks, months, or years. This alters its consistency and allows it to develop a more complex flavor.

PermissibleValues.value: Probiotic supplements (pills, liquid, powder; or other probiotics)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Probiotic supplements (pills, liquid, powder; or other probiotics)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A live microorganism used as a dietary supplement to help with digestion and normal bowel function. It may also help keep the gastrointestinal (GI) tract healthy. A bacterium found in yogurt called Lactobacillus acidophilus, is the most common probiotic._Oral preparations containing dietary ingredient(s) intended to supplement the diet.  Dietary ingredients include vitamins, minerals, herbs, amino acids, extracts and metabolites.

Concepts.definition: A live microorganism used as a dietary supplement to help with digestion and normal bowel function. It may also help keep the gastrointestinal (GI) tract healthy. A bacterium found in yogurt called Lactobacillus acidophilus, is the most common probiotic.
Oral preparations containing dietary ingredient(s) intended to supplement the diet.  Dietary ingredients include vitamins, minerals, herbs, amino acids, extracts and metabolites.

PermissibleValues.value: Salt fermented pickles or veggies (no vinegar)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Salt fermented pickles or veggies (no vinegar)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Vegetables that are prepared by dry salting or brining, followed by Lactobacillus fermentation.

Concepts.definition: Vegetables that are prepared by dry salting or brining, followed by Lactobacillus fermentation.
